material.mattext: Which of the following standards is commonly used for Wi-Fi communication?
What is the maximum theoretical data transfer rate of 802.11n Wi-Fi standard?
Which of the following is not a Wi-Fi security protocol?
Which Wi-Fi technology allows multiple devices to communicate simultaneously?
Which Wi-Fi technology enables communication over longer distances?
Which of the following is a Wi-Fi authentication method that requires a username and password?
Which Wi-Fi standard introduced the use of Multiple User-Multiple Input Multiple Output (MU-MIMO)?
Which Wi-Fi technology allows devices to connect to a network without entering a password?
What is the maximum data transfer rate supported by 802.11ax Wi-Fi standard?
Which Wi-Fi technology is designed for low-power devices and applications?
Which Wi-Fi standard introduced the concept of frame aggregation to improve throughput?
Which Wi-Fi technology allows devices to connect directly to each other without an access point?
What is the primary advantage of using Wi-Fi 6 (802.11ax) technology?
Which Wi-Fi technology allows seamless handover between multiple access points within the same network?
Which Wi-Fi security protocol is considered the most secure?
Which Wi-Fi technology is designed specifically for Internet of Things (IoT) devices?
Which Wi-Fi technology allows devices to connect to a cellular network for voice and data services?
